entry.name: selectable
entry.desc: Use the mouse to select individual or a group of elements

longdesc.p: The jQuery UI Selectable plugin allows for elements to be selected by dragging a box (sometimes called a lasso) with the mouse over the elements. Also, elements can be selected by click or drag while holding the Ctrl/Meta key, allowing for multiple (non-contiguous) selections.
This interaction requires some functional CSS, otherwise it won't work. If you build a custom theme, use the interaction's specific CSS file as a starting point.

option.name: autoRefresh
option.desc: This determines whether to refresh (recalculate) the position and size of each selectee at the beginning of each select operation. If you have many many items, you may want to set this to false and call the refresh method manually.

option.name: cancel
option.desc: Prevents selecting if you start on elements matching the selector.

option.name: delay
option.desc: Time in milliseconds to define when the selecting should start. It helps preventing unwanted selections when clicking on an element.

option.name: disabled
option.desc: Disables the selectable if set to true.

option.name: distance
option.desc: Tolerance, in pixels, for when selecting should start. If specified, selecting will not start until after mouse is dragged beyond distance.

option.name: filter
option.desc: The matching child elements will be made selectees (able to be selected).

option.name: tolerance
option.desc:
Possible values: 'touch', 'fit'.
'''fit''': draggable overlaps the droppable entirely
'''touch''': draggable overlaps the droppable any amount

event.name: create
event.desc: This event is triggered when the selectable is created.

event.name: selected
event.desc: This event is triggered at the end of the select operation, on each element added to the selection.

property.name: selected
property.desc: The selectable item that has been selected

event.name: selecting
event.desc: This event is triggered during the select operation, on each element added to the selection.

property.name: selecting
property.desc: The current selectable item being selected

event.name: start
event.desc: This event is triggered at the beginning of the select operation.

event.name: stop
event.desc: This event is triggered at the end of the select operation.

event.name: unselected
event.desc: This event is triggered at the end of the select operation, on each element removed from the selection.

property.name: unselected
property.desc: The selectable item that has been unselected

event.name: unselecting
event.desc: This event is triggered during the select operation, on each element removed from the selection.

property.name: unselecting
property.desc: The current selectable item being unselected

method.name: refresh
method.desc: Refresh the position and size of each selectee element. This method can be used to manually recalculate the position and size of each selectee element. Very useful if autoRefresh is set to false.
